chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: received and filed.
Order to Appoint Guardian Ad Litem at County Expense, signed and filed.
Order to Appoint Guardian Ad Litem at County Expense, received.

Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis Schwantes and Attorney Haley E Wentz in court with Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah.  


Matter in court for State's Motion to Have Person Removed as Victim under Marsy's Law and to have Guardian Ad Litem Appointed for Minor Victim.  Defense has submitted a Motion opposing state's request. Additional statements are made.  Court finds state's motion to be meritorious and GRANTS state's motion. Court appoints Legal Aid society.  State to submit an order.

Defense has received discovery.  Defense request scheduling conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JustiicePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.

DEFENDANT'S MOTION OPPOSING STATE'S REQUEST TO DECLARE A PERSON A
NON-VICTIM DUE TO LACK OF STANDING, received and filed.
from JusticePoint, received and filed.

Defendant Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah in court with attorney Haley E Wentz and Travis Schwantes.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has filed a motion.  Defense request an oppurtunity to respond.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.
MOTION TO HAVE PERSON REMOVED AS VICTIM UNDER MARSY'S LAW AND TO HAVE GUARDIAN AD LITEM APPOINTED FOR MINOR VICTIM, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial report, received and filed.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah in court, appear by video with attorney Travis Schwantes, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Khinma R.
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 15. Defendant Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Ken Olstinski for Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
FOR BRANCH 15.  Case calendared for Bail/Bond Hearing and Indigency Hearing.  Interpreter waived for this appearance.  Defendant has posted bail and is now Public Defender eligible.  Both hearings moot.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing June 28, 2022 at 8:30 am in Prelim Court.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Sworn as Rohingya interpreter: Khinma Uddin

Court ordered no contact with IZ DOB 1/1/07 and her family
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered passport and all other travel documents to be surrendered to RM 117 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shafiullah Haji-Amanullah appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense requests Indigency Hearing. Court suggests Bail Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 12 for Br. 15. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
